section.section: The Governor shall appoint the members of the Board with the advice of the Secretary and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

text.section:
Each member of the Board shall be:
a citizen of the United States; and
a resident of the State.

section.section:
Each member appointed under subsection (a)(2)(i), (ii), and (iii) of this section:
shall be an active contractor;
shall hold a current active license under this title or under a licensing program in a subdivision of the State; and
shall have provided services as a contractor for not less than 5 consecutive years immediately prior to the date of appointment.

The master electrician member of the Board:
shall be actively engaged in the electrical contracting business as a master electrician;
shall hold a current active license under this article; and
shall have been engaged in business as a master electrician for not less than 5 consecutive years immediately prior to the date of appointment.

The master plumber member of the Board:
shall be actively engaged in the plumbing contracting business as a master plumber;
shall hold a current active license under this article; and
shall have been engaged in business as a master plumber for not less than 5 consecutive years immediately prior to the date of appointment.

text.section:
Each consumer member of the Board:
shall be a member of the general public;
may not be a licensee or otherwise be subject to the regulation of the Board; and
may not have had within 1 year before appointment a financial interest in or have received compensation from a person regulated by the Board.
Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 3 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on January 1, 1993.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
Board members are eligible for reappointment, but may not serve more than 2 consecutive terms.
The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
